urls.title: The Chilterns AONB - News
urls.description: Buckinghamshire Council and the Chilterns Conservation Board have serious concerns about the impacts of HS2‚Äôs tunnelling operations on Buckinghamshire‚Äôs aquifer and chalk streams. These concerns relate to pollution resulting from tunnelling operations, increasing abstraction of water and impacts on the flow of significant chalk streams, such as the River Misbourne. A joint Position Statement has been issued with a series of questions regarding these concerns, and the Council and the Chilterns Conservation

tweets.text:
Here is a good statement reflecting our concerns with regard to HS2 Tunnelling and the impact on the chalk aquifer https://t.co/tUIdNMbtSW
It is with sadness we announce a very compliant @EnvAgency have approved the tunnelling without any public consultation.

urls.title: Start of the close season: How do we protect our breeding fish at this time of year?
urls.description: Matt Buck, Fisheries Technical Specialist for the Midlands, explains how close season helps protect our breeding fish. Well the evenings are getting lighter, and across the country fish are starting to move out of their winter haunts - a sure ‚Ä¶

tweets.text:
The coarse fish close season has started. This means it‚Äôs illegal to fish for coarse fish in rivers until 15th June inclusive.  

Don‚Äôt forget, there are plenty of still waters or canal coarse fisheries where you can fish. 

Learn more: https://t.co/u6IhTpkgUB https://t.co/ujbBmr7aUX

We finally cleared the enormous rubbish pile from the River Douglas! 
Incredible teamwork @stormwater_jo @Mike_Forty @VitaminSNC @DouglasPilot @RibbleTrust @WiganCouncil @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgencyNW 
Before and after photos https://t.co/Mo59VFOzlI
People have to fight not only polluting industries but now also the @EnvAgency and their own government @DefraGovUK to stop the rot. How on earth did that happen? https://t.co/oN4HCpp52u

Great news that @ClintonDevon and @EnvAgency have made a positive statement on the future of the Lower Otter Restoration Project. Well done and I look forward to the positives of this exciting new projectüëáüëá https://t.co/rSWitABojN

UPDATE - After the appeal we put out last night to @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @kiergroup & @NESouthWest there was no nest destruction today at the River Otter Restoration Project in Devon and the partners are reconsidering their plans - thank you . Top work @WiseBirding et al . https://t.co/A8KSk5gcuE

urls.title: Drilling monitoring wells into abandoned mine workings
urls.description: WB&AD Morgan is working with Dunelm and installing a monitoring well to prevent catastrophic contamination from an abandoned coal mine.

tweets.text:
Working with @DunelmGeotech for @EnvAgency we've installed a monitoring well at Cronton Colliery so water that's still rising in the closed mines can be intercepted before it causes pollution:
https://t.co/YixEGNdKcd
#MonitoringWell #Borehole #Innovation https://t.co/GtWVSMR8ee

urls.title: More than a thousand stolen catalytic converters recovered following national crackdown
urls.description: Police forces across the nation have recovered over a thousand stolen catalytic converters and arrested more than 50 people as part of a joint operation to tackle catalytic converter theft.

tweets.text:
Following a massive increase in the theft of catalytic converters across the country. 
The Environment Agency teamed up with @BTP and other partners nationally and recovered over a thousand stolen catalytic converters and more than 50 people were arrested
https://t.co/WA12K6y7YB https://t.co/9dHTQphMPY

To ensure future allocation of #water resources is safeguarded & optimised @EnvAgency is renovating Great Ouse #Groundwater Scheme, which pumps water to local rivers & to Essex during dry summers as part of Ely Ouse to Essex Transfer Scheme https://t.co/F7KhdyXJQf
I am hearing that @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @NESouthWest may have finally seen sense!? @ChrisGPackham @Natures_Voice @DevonWildlife https://t.co/fAB6uuBlCW

@davemh72 @LoneRanger77777 @DrMickSalt @Samanth33412592 @StinkStopthe @RedIndustries2 @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA @DefraGovUK @Cap_it_off @SimonTagg @AaronBell4NUL We can only wonder what they have put in, but I bet they never thought it would get to this stage, EA and PHE need to really act fast in the best interests of the public as the truth will come out just like the terrible smell did! https://t.co/HUc1TkHjjP

urls.title: Is the Environment Agency doing its job?
urls.description: Guy Linley-Adams, Solicitor to Salmon & Trout Conservation, shares the findings from their new report on the role of the Environment Agency & why greater investment is needed to make our rivers, lakes, and streams healthy by 2027.

tweets.text: Is the Environment Agency doing its job? via @wcl_news https://t.co/Jv8p9Je01t @EnvAgency

It's rare that I regret going outside but today I saw my local council indiscriminately spraying huge quantities of herbicide and it gave me, to borrow @Lucy_Lapwing's terms, the eco-worries. The planet poo-poos. Here's a thread of the pavement plants doused in herbicideüåºü§ç 1/16 https://t.co/oRgetV9ZDT

Vegetation clearance starts from tomorrow. A very short visit this am incl: nest building Whitethroat, territorial Cetti's/Reed Warbler & Reed Bunting. Video shows how farcical this is! Still time to see sense @EnvAgency @kiergroup @Natures_Voice @Bucktonbirder  PLEASE RETWEET https://t.co/Tve0B6o4va

urls.title: The Chilterns AONB - News
urls.description: Buckinghamshire Council and the Chilterns Conservation Board have serious concerns about the impacts of HS2‚Äôs tunnelling operations on Buckinghamshire‚Äôs aquifer and chalk streams. These concerns relate to pollution resulting from tunnelling operations, increasing abstraction of water and impacts on the flow of significant chalk streams, such as the River Misbourne. A joint Position Statement has been issued with a series of questions regarding these concerns, and the Council and the Chilterns Conservation

tweets.text:
A joint statement from @ChilternsAONB & @BucksCouncil
on the potential damage - beyond the obvious- caused by boring massive holes in a fractured chalk geology. 
The questions raised here need serious address, not spin and rubber stamp approval @EnvAgency
https://t.co/kbOkQgUjAG https://t.co/zKTjm7TByN
If you see sewage fungus please report it to @NatResWales  on 0300 065 3000  or the @EnvAgency  agency on 0800 80 70 60 (3/3)

Helping @EnvAgency and @ArupGroup understand the impacts of the Newlay Weir collapse, by completing cross section, bathymetric and topographic #surveys on the River Aire.

@RiverSurveyor @AlexLyall_SG @RiverAireLeeds #spatialdata #flooding #korecphotocomp https://t.co/QutFLLAZaJ

@WiseBirding @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @NESouthWest @ChrisGPackham @Natures_Voice @DevonWildlife Very well done for being so proactive and caring Chris, most of us want this project but not at the expense of breeding birds and other critters so thank you from them all üëç

@WiseBirding @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @NESouthWest @ChrisGPackham @Natures_Voice @DevonWildlife There is no 'soft way' to remove scrub during the bird breeding season, whilst this halt is ok, the only fully acceptable outcome is no work until August, any other options take us back to the same legal position. Watch this carefully.

Your spring clean shouldn't litter our countryside.

If you want more action on fly tipping, add your name to our open letter to the Police & Crime Commissioner https://t.co/2xkk9taql9

üì∏ @turbotechdog https://t.co/5w3PDr7hZ0

tweets.text:
2021 in ‚ÄòGreat‚Äô Britain, hailed as a developed country,one of the wealthiest in the world&with top scientists. 
And good old @ClareDinnisEA thinks she can convince me to let this go? Not until hell freezes over @Cap_it_off #stopthestink @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @MPGeorgeEustice https://t.co/yS03VJ5CGv

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Hi Feargal, if you have concerns regarding non compliance with the First-Tier Tribunal‚Äôs decision, you should raise your concerns with them. We do not have jurisdiction over the Tribunal‚Äôs decision. Regards, Hannah
@olly_e_m @ouramma @ExeterCouncil @DevonCC @EnvAgencySW Longer grass/vegetation would #slowtheflow
@PJennings88 @EnvAgency Just to clarify they've issued the licence to drill then? Many thanks  speakout.rebelle@protonmail.com

@Anna_Dillon @ChilternsAONB @BucksCouncil @EnvAgency @Feargal_Sharkey @AquiferChalk It reminds me of the same stupidity that was circulating decades ago, when it was suggested that nuclear waste could be safely disposed of by firing it at the sun.  You shouldn't tamper with a natural system that isn't fully understood! We don't understand the aquifer fully.

tweets.text: *This* is why we have a phosphate pollution problem in Herefordshire rivers. Massive pile of chicken muck dumped right next to watercourse. Completely against the farming rules for water. I‚Äôve just reported it to @EnvAgency.  Totally unacceptable.  And not an isolated incident. https://t.co/1l45pAbllG

@WiseBirding @ClintonDevon @EnvAgency So encouraging that a constructive way forward is emerging. Shows why it‚Äôs always worth speaking up about avoidable threats to nature on our doorsteps, even if doing so feels a bit uncomfortable. Well done Chris and everyone involved - including the project partners.

I don't usually do this sort of thing, but when it is on my local patch it really gets to me!! Scrub & tree removal in May is terrible practice. Please retweet. https://t.co/cYEIymHH0K Two videos showing the area & my concerns. @DevonWildlife @Natures_Voice @EnvAgency @kiergroup https://t.co/U8doUyBP5K

@davemh72 @MrMarkwarren1 @StinkStopthe @LoneRanger77777 @DrMickSalt @Samanth33412592 @RedIndustries2 @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA @DefraGovUK @Cap_it_off @SimonTagg @AaronBell4NUL Yes, going forward this problem may exist for years to come I‚Äôm afraid
